page.title: 09Killamarsh Teenagers
page.content: We went Eckington School in our teacher's car because it is three and half miles away from our village. All the children in our village go here when they leave the Junior School. We talked to one boy and two girls. The boy's favourite subject was Philosophy and when he left school he wanted to be a teacher. His favourite sport was football. The two girls both wanted to be engineers when they left school. None of the three thought they stood much chance of getting a job because of the high unemployment. They didn't like their School because they thought it didn't prepare them for life after school. They also thought that there were too many silly rules and that the teachers treated the children badly and never listened to their points of view. The biggest difficulty at school was catching the right bus.
